pageContext.description: Plain bracelet shows join, also evidence of hammering, and slight tinning. Lower bracelet decorated with incised herringbone strokes.
pageContext.patina: Upper bracelet slightly tinned. Lower very dark. thick patina.
pageContext.other: Bottom left of card says "F. de M. M.". Diagram shows two bracelets, and is headed: "Total numbers of each type beside drawings", but it looks as though the first sketch (with "(2)" beside it) has been struck through, and it says "on the new card". However, Description & Patina still seem to relate to two bracelets.
pageContext.collection: Salisbury Museum,on loan from Miss Belfield
pageContext.site: England,Wilts,Ebbesbourrne Wake,Found in LBA lynchet at Monks Hole in 1944
pageContext.toSearch: Ebbesbourne Wake, Salisbury, Wiltshire Sp5, UK
